snippet: THESE are not days of unalloyed joy in the California wine country. What with grape prices going through the roof, phylloxera-ravaged vineyards to replant, flat sales and many wineries on the block, the wine makers have more crises than a Joan Cra...
lead_paragraph: THESE are not days of unalloyed joy in the California wine country. What with grape prices going through the roof, phylloxera-ravaged vineyards to replant, flat sales and many wineries on the block, the wine makers have more crises than a Joan Crawford movie. If none of this moves you to tears, wait until the next time you stop by your local purveyor for a bottle of something to spark up dinner. It won't take much aisle-wandering to realize that just about everything that was $10 on your last visit is $15 now.
